item.title: Deformed Newton's $(s,t)$-Binomial Series and Generating Functions of Generalized Central Binomial Coefficients and Generalized Catalan Numbers
item.description: arXiv:2306.07431v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We define the deformed $(s,t)$-binomial formula and the deformed Newton $(s,t)$-binomial series, and we will use it to establish the generating functions of the generalized central binomial coefficients and the generalized Catalan numbers.
item.dc:creator: Ronald Orozco L\'opez

item.title: A note on the Irrationality of $\zeta(5)$ and Higher Odd Zeta Values
item.description: arXiv:2407.07121v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this note, we prove the irrationality of $\zeta(5)$ and generalise the method to prove irrationality of higher odd zeta values. Our proof relies on the method of contradiction, existence of solution of Linear Diophantine equation and mathematical induction. For $n\geq 1$, we denote $d_n=\text{lcm}(1,2,...,n)$. In the first part of the article, we assume $\zeta(5)$ is rational, say $a/b$. Then we observe that for $n\geq b$, there exists an equation involving linear combination of $\zeta(5)$ with coefficients $d_n$ that has a solution. Later using existence of solution of Linear Diophantine equation, we show that such a linear combination of $\zeta(5)$ has no solution, which is a contradiction. In the second part of the article, we generalise this method for all higher odd zeta values.
item.dc:creator: Shekhar Suman

item.title: On proving an Inequality of Ramanujan using Explicit Order Estimates for the Mertens Function
item.description: arXiv:2407.12052v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This research article provides an unconditional proof of an inequality proposed by Srinivasa Ramanujan involving the Prime Counting Function $\pi(x)$, \begin{align*} (\pi(x))^{2}<\frac{ex}{\log x}\pi\left(\frac{x}{e}\right) \end{align*} for every real $x\geq \exp(547)$, using specific order estimates for the Mertens Function, $M(x)$. The proof primarily hinges upon investigating the underlying relation between $M(x)$ and the Second Chebyshev Function, $\psi(x)$, in addition to applying the meromorphic properties of the Riemann Zeta Function, $\zeta(s)$ with an intention of deriving an improved approximation for $\pi(x)$.
